sen.j: 五辻家（いつつじけ）は宇多源氏の流れを引く源氏堂上源氏。
sen.e: The Itsutsuji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), who is a descendant of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Itsutsuji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), descendants of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Itsutsuji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), descendants of Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 用語共有に沿って、(the Minamoto clan → (Minamoto clan に修正。

sen.j: 左大臣・源雅信の子源時方（ときまさ）を祖とする。
sen.e: Its patriarch was MINAMOTO no Tokimasa, a son of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Masanobu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its patriarch was MINAMOTO no Tokimasa, the son of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Masanobu.
Its patriarch was MINAMOTO no Tokimasa, the son of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Masanobu.

sen.j: 五辻仲兼（生没年不詳）以降に五辻家を称する。
sen.e: After Nakakane ITSUTSUJI (year of birth and death unknown) the family name was changed to the Itsutsuji family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Nakakane ITSUTSUJI (year of birth and death unknown) the family name was changed to the Itsutsuji.
After Nakakane ITSUTSUJI (year of birth and death unknown) the family name was changed to the Itsutsuji.

sen.j: 五辻仲兼以降は蔵人所や北面の武士を務める地下人だった。
sen.e: Nakakane ITSUTSUJI was a jigenin (low ranking court noble) who served at Kurododokoro (Chamberlain's Office) and as a member of the Imperial Palace Guards of the north side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nakakane ITSUTSUJI was a jigenin (low ranking court noble) who served at Kurododokoro (Chamberlain's Office) and as a member of the Imperial Palace Guards of the north side.
Nakakane ITSUTSUJI was a jigenin (a lower rank of ancient Japanese nobility) who served at Kurododokoro (Chamberlain's Office) and Hokumen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the north side).
sen.cmt: 用語共有に沿って、地下人、北面の武士の表現を修正。

sen.j: しかし、1538年に五辻諸仲（従三位・治部省）（1487年～1540年）が従三位に叙せられてからは、堂上家に加わる。
sen.e: However, after Moronaka ITSUTSUJI (Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Jibusho (the Ministry of Civil Administration)) (1487 - 1540) was given the rank of Jusammi in 1538, the family was added as a toshoke family (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, after Moronaka ITSUTSUJI (Jusanmi - Junior Third Rank) and Jibusho (the Ministry of Civil Administration) (1487 - 1540) was given the rank of Jusammi in 1538, the family was added as a toshoke family (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank).

However, after Moronaka ITSUTSUJI (Jusanmi - Junior Third Rank) and Jibusho (the Ministry of Civil Administration) (1487 - 1540) was given the rank of Jusanmi in 1538, the family was added as a toshoke family (hereditary lineage of court nobles above a certain rank).

sen.j: 家格は半家 (公家)、極官は従二位・非参議。
sen.e: The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge (court noble)), and the highest court positions appointed were Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge -court noble), and the highest court positions appointed were Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
The family status is hanke (family of lower ranking court nobles) (kuge -court noble), and the highest court positions appointed were Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Hisangi (advisor at large).
The family specialized in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) as their profession.
The family specialized in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) as their profession.
The family specialized in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) as their profession.

sen.j: 五辻家からは慈光寺家が分かれ出た。
sen.e: The Jikoji family branched out from the Itsutsuji family.
The Jikoji family branched out from the Itsutsuji family.
The Jikoji family branched out from the Itsutsuji family.
